headline: Avoid working in IT dept at all costs
status:
22 October 2020
"Avoid working in IT dept at all costs"
1.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros: Insurance covers sudden death at work
cons: Old school management in IT where political game play was far more important than being good at the job. Working in their IT department was without a doubt the worst experience in my lifetime. It was a very political and difficult working environment to work in. I would never consider working here in future. Lack of career progression and promotion opportunities at all which really affects the long serving staff. Majority of staff are unfriendly to work with.
advice_to_mgmt: Be more genuine to junior people

headline: More work-life balance than most finance jobs
pros:
Good work balance, supportive colleagues
Provides training and continuous learning opportunities
Unique position in financial infrastuctue to work with industry leaders and regulators
cons:
Outdated computers and software, aversion to new technology in some departments
Repetitive work may sometimes feel unimpactful or inconsequential
Decision making and changes take a long time
advice_to_mgmt:
Give constructive feedback on a more frequent basis, to allow employees a chance to improve before annual evaluation
Update computers and software to bring all departments up to speed

headline: Famous Brand Name but not the truth from the eye of insider
status:
5 January 2018
Helpful (7)
"Famous Brand Name but not the truth from the eye of insider"
1.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros:
1. Fair salary & benefit
2. Famous Brand Name
3. Not frequent turnover(staff movement)
4. Many Cons
cons:
1. Tedious task & admin work (Overload task & Multi-task, No rest)
2. People are extremely unfriendly
a) (Difficult to communicate, people are blacked-face all the time, you are expected to listen many obnoxious exhortation (i.e. uncomfortable speaking) from different colleague when you have made a negligibly simple mistake even in attitude & gestures)
b) Too many people are perfectionist & unrealistic which makes the entire process ineffective & unproductive
c) People are selfishly arrogant, self-centered, unconsciously unhelpful which makes a disharmony & stressful, frustrated working environment, which becomes a obviously huge gap between different position level. 
3. Office Politics
4. Strict internal rules, Complicated procedures & control is required to follow
5. Long working hours
6. Insufficient management on resources allocation(i.e. unlimited workload vs limited staff)
7. Hard to have promotion for junior staff
8. Very Old-minded set for some Old/Senior staff 
9. Working culture is close-minded & conservative (people are insisted and would not willing to accept other's feedback, especially senior staff)
10. Famous Brand Name but not really the truth for the insider.
11. Working under pressure everytime.
12. Not Caring about staff's personal mind but only force you to follow their usual pattern. (unwilling to change their bad habit)
13. Chaos Management 
14. Bad working environment & messy company structure~chaos
15. Hard to claim OT with bad feelings
16. Unbalance working life
17. Limited learning curve
18. Poor technology and outdated system
19. Wasting paper (Lots of printout)
20. HK-style management (urgent & no time of rest)
advice_to_mgmt:
1. Respect & Care staff
2. Allocate more resources on people
3. Accept criticism 
4. Try to remove conservative mind set

headline: Associate

Less politics, nice location to work, not frequent staff movement, you can get help easily cos most people are experienced and they are willing to share their experience, good bonus.

cons: conservative atmosphere, people are redundant to change, micromanagement, no respect to the staff. Traditional company culture. No career path for junior staff.
